reviews.review_msg: It's an okay class if you're able to balance your time for each week's activities. Discussion response due Fridays (participation marks) + tutorial assignments due Sundays. The tutorials require reading that week's course material and being able to analyze information to complete the tutorial assignments. Midterm/final was in person, all MC's.

the prof was really nice and his lectures were organized nicely. there's weekly tutorials and assignments which were pretty straightforward. midterm and final  was all mc but questions weren't the easiest. but overall a fair class

Solid choice for SFU students looking to fulfill their Science Breadth graduation credit requirements. In class and tutorial assessments were clear and doable but the exams were considerably more tricky and difficult. Overall, a wonderful professor that made the course as exactly as it was in terms of grading, expectations, and material.

Very good professor, lectures are short and informative, grading is very fair. I found his exams (all MCQs) easy to pass but hard to ace in that sense. However, assignments and participation marks definitely carry, so getting a good mark is doable for sure. Attend tutorials and study slides religiously for exams, flashcards for sure.
He included a freebie question as the last question on the final (the answer was given as it was the only choice on the MCQ). For that, I will say if you're reading this, I love you Brendan!!

You can't really ask for more, Dr. Murphy made the course exactly as it was meant to be, a light intro to environmental science concepts. Study definitions hard, they appear extensively on exams. Exams are fair.

This class has been really chill. It's been fun learning from his online lectures. Highly recommend this class as the workload isn't demanding at all, and the content can be interesting if you're invested enough

I thought evsc 100 was exactly what it needed to be! Murphy's online lectures were clear and informative while remaining concise and only 30-45 minutes each. His assignments are well organized and he is very transparent about his expectations for exams. This course is a great option for non-science majors who are looking for a science credit.
He is a great prof. Explains stuff very clearly, and the Canvas course is quite organized too. Exams are also very straightforward.

Solid elective to take if you can handle a bit of reading and analysis. Brendan is really chill too, and the assessments are pretty doable. The midterm was a bit iffy, but overall I'd still recommend the class
He is very chill, really good professor

Straightforward class, relatively fair exams, and I found the content interesting. Only con is that his communication isn't very good, the midterm took nearly 5 weeks to come back due to scantron issues, and he never communicated that with us. Rarely posts announcements or keeps us informed. Good class, okay ish prof.

The class itself is easy: weekly modules that take a couple hours to go through, plus a tutorial assignment. Study terms thoroughly, they definitely appear on the exams. The one con is that he still hasn't released our midterms even though we wrote them almost a month ago :(
But the course itself is good.

Love this Prof! He's very kind and helpful. The course isn't terribly difficult either - tutorial assignments (35% of the grade) are very straightforward and basically free marks. Some questions on the midterm were tricky, but overall it was very fair. I'd recommend the course with Dr. Murphy to anyone!

Honestly this is probably the most boring elective I have taken in my two years at SFU. The instructions under tutorial assignments are so vague and one has to keep switching and referring back to quiz and multible tabs for almost every question. It's riduculously annoying. Sometimes the graphs and websites used are so difficult to navigate as well

This course is really enjoyable - weekly modules that contain articles, an online tutorial assignment, and some engagement activities. Prof Murphy is very organized and has all of the resources ready for each module, and the resources are very helpful. Tutorial assignments are very fair. Overall, this course is great for learning about environment!

Lectures were always posted on time and they were well edited. Tutorial assignment and weekly engagement activities were always fair and relatively not too difficult. Overall an easy and fun course to take. The TA was also very nice and it was a pleasure to go to tutorials. There is no final either, just two non-cumulative midterms.

I took EVSC 100 online with Brendan this semester and it was the best course of my life. Super clear grading and very response over email. Super great lectures and the midterm and final exam were very fair. Would highly recommend taking it with Dr. Murphy if you have a chance!

I took an online class with him and exams were in person. The midterm consisted of a section of MC select all that apply but if you get one wrong, you get the whole question wrong! These questions were like two points each. Communication is very poor; I tried emailing him, never got a response. I recommend to just avoid this class if taught by him
This course was incredible, I used to be a business major but switched to environmental science after taking Brendans course. Can't say enough about how awesome this was.

Dr. Murphy was phenomenal, super enthusiastic and just awesome. Super engaging and truly cared about the material. One of the best, if not the best professor I've ever had. Can't wait to take EVSC 305 with him later!

He has asynchronous lectures that explain the heavy concepts in a clear and concise way. He's passionate about what he's teaching and is willing to explain a lot if you see him outside of class time. The course will not take a lot of your time but the exams are definitely a challenge.
Fine.
Good lectures, especially for being online, but he uses the word "right" after every single sentence and it drove me insane. Other than that he's great.
Material is super easy. Lots of assignments, but it's an online course, so it's fair.  Grading is sometimes unclear, as people mentioned before

Very engaging prof, even asks at the end of semester how she can teach better. Took 2  of her classes (GEOG111+EVSC100), learned a lot in both and got good grades too while not being super stressed about studying and workload.

Tara is one of the best professors I've had so far. She is very caring and tries her best to help everyone succeed. Lectures aren't recorded so attendance is suggested. Graded on lab worksheets, weekly activities, midterm, final, and portfolio. Super engaging and expectations are very clear. Would definitely take her class again!

took as a gpa booster. lectures were fully online, tutorials were in-person. dr. holland supplies lots of helpful resources and materials to foster your learning. lectures are also clear and easy to follow! everything was clearly explained and organized. TA did the grading and gave good feedback. recommend it for sure! [intersession, summer 2022]

For the online version of this course, instead of relying on one lecture or textbook she had an array of different sources you could click through. Everything in the course was explained clearly and connected, tutorials were relevant, and the the midterm and final was clearly explained. YMMV in-person, but the online modules were well planned.
Loved her classes. She goes out of her way to make sure the classes are engaging.

Dr. Holland is seriously my favourite prof of all time! I took this course as an elective and loved it so much that I'm switching my major, she's so inspiring! Her lectures are easy to follow and the weekly material only takes an hour or two. Her midterm and final are SUPER fair and it's easy to do well if you follow along :) 10/10 would recommend!

Tara is really understanding, compassionate, and inspiring. She delivers a good overview on EVSC issues, while also addressing how to remain optimistic. Labs are a breeze if you have taken any other STEM class. Tests only have content from learning goals on them, so easy to study for. Not a difficult course, but really engaging content.

I loved learning about environmental science because Tara made it super easy to understand the material. There are assignments and tutorials every week. Tests were fair and all you need to do is write notes every week and you'll be good for midterms and finals.

Dr. Holland is an amazing professor! You can tell she's passionate about what she's teaching. The course itself is also very interesting and quite easy if you go through all the materials provided (which is not an overwhelming amount like some online classes). She is very understanding and makes adjustments if you need. 10/10

One of the best, if not the best, professors adapting to online learning. Everything was clearly outlined e.g. the learning goals which made the midterm/final relatively easy as there were no surprises. Courseload wasn't hard whatsoever and content was made interesting as she managed to incorporate current events to the curriculum.

Tara's a good choice for science electives. Took her in Summer 2020 and the midterm and final were very confusing. I felt like I did alright, but turns out I barely passed and half of the class did poorly too. Tutorial assignments are a grade booster along with discussion posts.

Her course is well thought out, structured, organized, she's even very nice. She'd just not fit to be a professor due to her grading. I am a 4th year taking a 100 level course with her and she's the toughest grader I have this semester. Clear grading criteria, but she doesn't follow it herself. Most unfair marker I've had

For a 100 level course there were a lot of things she did that didnt make sense. Midterm was 70 short answer questions/mc she gave us only an hour to struggle through them. Way more concerned with making sure we couldnt cheat than if we learned. Resulted in low avg and she didnt take feedback aside from a delayed canvas survey 2 weeks later

Tara is super organized. No issues there. But I took this course online and she is delusioned about how online courses work. Midterm was super straight forward, yet over 50% of the class failed it because she insisted it be CLOSED BOOK. When I emailed her my concerns she basically said suck it up. She might be ok in person but avoid online

She cares about her students and tries extremely creative ways to improve your learning as a student. Attending lectures and tutorials will get you free marks, and studying her midterm/exam guideline will give you an easy A. Great prof!

Tara's a pretty damn good professor. Her class was super easy and she really tries to get her students engaged and make the material interesting. Exams are pretty easy, and the stuff you do in tutorials are as well. There's nothing bad to say about her tbh.

Environmental Science 100 was a great class! The lectures were really well organized revolving around a key concept that tied to every lesson. Attendance was mandatory, Prof Holland went into detail for each slide to help the students understand the concepts better.

She is a great prof, and she wants her students to succeed. A good portion of the grade percentage is from in-class participation and tutorial work, so it helps boosts your mark if you are not great at writing exams. She is also willing to revise your midterm if it was marked unfairly. Great prof!

Tara is a good prof and uses different teaching methods to make lectures engaging. Lots of group work/class discussion. Tutorials are useful as a supplementary aid, so try to attend those too. She marks fairly based on clear learning outcomes, which makes the course accessible as an elective even for non-environment-major students.
Never thought I would consider an environmental science major but I am now. Class is engaging and interesting! Midterm exam was fair, no surprises. Tutorials help a lot with understanding concepts.

The best professor I've had at SFU so far. I had him for EVSC 410 and despite being in my second year, he made the content very understandable and easy to follow with no background in restoration. Definitely recommended him in the course surveys. Make sure to take a class with him, he is an excellent professor!

Professor Chartrand is very passionate about what he does, he really tries to engage the class. The lectures were easy to understand and often he'd play videos or podcasts. I ran into him at Starbucks and he recognized me and said hello and we had a conversation. Very genuine caring professor. Lectures were interesting if you want them to be

Shawn is the best professor I've had at SFU, and the only one I've gotten to know on a personal level. I took EVSC100 with him and he was incredible. Clearly very passionate about his work and personable. He was a friendly face in the hallways and my friend and I were able to enjoy coffee with him a couple times during the semester. Take his class!
Super chill guy. You can tell he cares about his students, and is passionate about his field of study. All around he's a really great human.
HOMELANDER!!!!!

Had Shawn for EVSC100 in Fall 2023, and he was one of the easiest and best classes I've had. Easy-to-follow lectures and engaging short articles. One midterm, final, and easy weekly engagement quizzes. Tutorials are super easy as well (mostly just looking at charts + analysing data), but make sure to attend to understand the assignments.

Dr. Saraswat was extremely boring and monotone professor. The material had so much potential to be an awesome class but the way he taught it put the class to sleep. Very slow and uneventful teaching method and he just didn't seem that interested in teaching the class.

Arvind's class was quite interesting, informative and wasn't challenging! His lectures can be boring but he'll always make an effort to answer students' questions. The midterm and final were quite fair and on the easier side. Would definitely take another class with him. Very knowledgable and passionate about the subjects he discusses.

Arvind is a very nice prof. It seems like he cares for his students but his lectures are very dull. He also takes a long time to get back the exam marks. The only assignments we had were in tutorial, 1 midterm and a final. Overall choose another prof for this course if you want it to be interesting. But for an easy A this may be the course.

A very caring prof but I found his lectures dull. He strives to make sure you understand the content. There is no homework, projects or papers. Only graded on exams and tutorials. Read his notes and exams are easy to pass. Being able to explain concepts and memorization is what gets you good grades in this class. There are no trick questions.

He is the most kindest and caring prof, really passionate about what he teaches and made the course so interesting. Do not need to buy a textbook, solely relying on his slides, and exams are really fair. I would love to take another class with him
i think he made the final easier than the midterm. he's a good guy. gpa booster especially if you take with saraswat.

Lectures were informative and Dr. Saraswat really tries to engage the dead class by asking questions. Tutorials  easy 20% of overall grade. Try to do well on the midterm, because asides from that and tutorials, what's left is only the final exam. Easy course if you've done good in science 10 or are interested in environmental issues/concepts.
Not much science in this class - a few facts but little insight. Oh well an easy A
Awesome prof! No assignments, just attend lectures cuz you will be tested on it. Always relates environment topics to recent news and current events which made class interesting.

Christie did not make the lectures very interesting in my opinion. midterms and tests are tough. i got NO feedback on most on my grade Only my midterm ( 40% ) she never posted the marks for tutorial participation or even the final test mark ONLY my mark in the class overall at the end which is extremely frustrating!!!!

Christie was a great prof! Lectures were very interesting and she is easy to listen to. Exams can be tough but are based off of lectures slides, so just make sure to study those well. She gave us the long answer question for our final exam ahead of time, and even allowed us to run our answer by her ahead of time for feedback.

i do not recommend this class at all for an elective. it is a GPA dropper. unless you are really interested in the topic or pursuing it. lectures are boring and may not even be 100% relevant to what is on the test. tutorials are helpful.

Incredibly difficult class for a 100-level intro course. The exams make the course extremely hard. She talks for 3 hours straight and at times,  this teaching style provokes you to daze off in the middle of class. Tutorials are okay, but this class with this prof SHOULD NOT be taken as an elective!

Christie's lectures were not mandatory at all. I went to five lectures all year and just downloaded the powerpoint later. She reads directly off the screen so you aren't gaining anything by being in her class. The tutorial helped my grade but it wasn't really relevant to passing the class.

talks for about 7 solid minutes each slide which gets kinda dry... very clear up beat loud voice. Unclear about what exact material she is putting on the tests which are each worth 40% and will test you on things said during lecture so take lots of notes.

Very cool prof! Very passionate about his teaching. He makes this course interesting. The midterm was super easy, but final was a little difficult but fair (there are bonus questions). Although he provides every ppt from class, you would still want to listen his lecture. He is very friendly that he would like to help you if you have any questions.
His lectures are very informative and not boring at all. Don't buy the book, you won't use it. Best professor!

very cool dude. funny and really likable, even with the option of listening to his recorded lectures online you still want to go be there in person because he makes the topics engaging... also he makes poetry in class

Nicest and most engaging prof I have ever had. His lectures were entertaining and the tutorials were fun. Definitely a GPA booster, with minimal studying, just stick to reviewing his slides! I would definitely recommend his class if you (or aren't) interested in the environment
Great Professor, very passionate about his work. Lectures were interesting and the information was easy to retain. Definitely a GPA Booster if some level of effort is made.

He is laidback, engaging and passionate about what he teaches.I'd say that he has to be one of the best and most interesting profs I've had so far. This class is a definite GPA booster for those who put in even the slightest bit of effort, and the midterm and final are more than fair. :)
One of the best profs at SFU!
So far the best teacher I ever had. Very motivated and passionate about the topic he teaches. Awesome dude!
The prof gives us the online version of textbook which is good. The exam is hard to get the mark.
Loved this prof, it was kind of a teach it to yourself type of class but she always came to class excited to teach. She was also time efficient and LOVED her guest lecturer. Easy science credit.

I know it's not Ruth's fault but holy, assignments not marked throughout the entire semester until day before the 
 final. And now still waiting for final grade for 2 weeks. Hard to navigate the class when you don't have your grades the entire time. the final was insane I don't know where that material even came from.

this course was strange. The exams didn't make any sense and were extremely hard. otherwise this course was very easy with little homework? 50% of your grade is on tutorials/quizzes. nothing was marked until the very last minute. exams didn't reflect what was taught in an extreme way but you'll be fine if you do all the homework. so weird

She does go through about 90 slides in two hours (and almost never finishes them), however the slides are to supplement the reading thats supposed to be done, so as long as you do the readings, youll be fine. her tests are quite hard, and there is a lot of memorization in this course but its totally doable if you use her question bank

I took this class when things got moved online due to COVID-19 and she was super cool about cancelling the final exam. However, before the online switch she sucked. Made everyone sit with no spaces in between each other use 90 slides in 2 hours and the Mid term is brutal. She gives an 800 question question bank and expects you to know all 800.

Marine is a really kind, caring, and awesome professor who understands the struggles students are facing and is accommodative towards us. She was kind enough to cancel the final due to the COVID-19 pandemic which eased a lot of stress off our shoulders and I cant thank her enough. The work is informative and she is an outstanding professor.

I honestly don't understand why Marnie's ratings are so low. I am typically a B+ student but this class was the easiest I've ever taken in my three years at SFU. Just memorize her test banks as both midterms and finals take questions entirely from these. With minimal effort I got an A+. Ignore the other ratings because this class is a breeze!

Marnie sucks. She crams 90 slides into two hours, and covers each slide wayyy too quickly and expects you to write down thorough notes because they're part of the exam. Within those 2 hours, she throws in an in-class assignment! There are WAY too many readings. Tutorial isn't spent on the concepts from lecture, but instead we're assigned MORE work!
Whole class is based on how well you can memorize. Can be interesting, but can also be boring. If you can memorize well, then this should be a good class.

Marnie believes that her exams tests understanding and not memorization, but then proceeds to give us a 800 question bank to memorize to do well on the exams. Don't take any class with this professor if you value your time and money
Marnie is very disorganized. The tests require a question bank to be memorized but she only gives it to us 4 days in advance. Good luck memorizing 400 questions in 4 days.
Nice person but bad teacher. Test answers must be word for word from the powerpoint slides, otherwise marks were not given. This class is not recommended.

As a person she is nice and easy to approach. Course content is interesting and well connected to labs. BIGGEST issue is exams: multiple choice questions (mostly fair) but written questions which are EXTREMELY SPECIFIC and very challenging plus an essay too. There are question banks but are uploaded way too late to be effective studying methods.

Although she may give out hard quizzes, she's the nicest prof I have ever had. She genuinely cares about here students and wants them to do well. I think the people that gave her bad ratings just didn't work hard enough and are salty.

Terrible prof. She tells us to study hard so we do better on our finals and the class does just that. Instead, she proceeds to reduce our marks by 4%. If you want a teacher that does not care about your education than take this class
Good luck trying to finish 800 exam bank questions a week before your final pal. Tutorial absence  automatic zero on assignments totalling to 20% of your final.

Marnie is a passionate professor with an engaging and straight-forward way of teaching. Her provision of test banks for both the midterm and final allows everyone an equal chance of succeeding in the course and as long as you make sure you complete every question, the class is an easy A. Highly recommend!

Going for lectures is key because she explains content well + exam hints aplenty. Exams were fairly manageable if you complete the question bank (given 2 weeks-ish before the exam), which can be done bc a lot is just MCQ. Ans are found in both slides and tb. (Office hour helps if you are stuck) Made me genuinely more interested in evsc.
Expects you to answer exam questions with exact definitions, she has difficult tests

1) middy review was 800+ questions and given the week before exam... BUT all exam questions from the review 2) tutorials are mandatory and have stupid assignments 3) hates when you're on your phone 4) she says you need the textbook (bc she wrote it) but quiz lit has everything

Took the class 3 years ago and I feel I need to get this off my chest. Worst class I had in university PERIOD. Professor was condescending and rude in email correspondences. Question bank handout had WAY too many questions to complete in 1 week. Only 50-60% of the answers can be found in lecture notes. Exam is the week after handout is made public.
This isnt a fun class to take. I hated it. ITS SO HARD FOR A 100 LEVEL COURSE. literally so much work its craxy. Exams are hard. Dont take it I recommend!

For a 100 level course it was way too much material, we basically had to teach ourselves half the course because she didn't cover all the chapters fully in lecture. WASTED TIME moving people around the lecture hall just to answer questions together, forced people to talk to each other & called you out in a rude way if you don't. Exams marked hard

she makes you do too much work for a 100-level course. Read the textbook, because her question bank's answers can not be found anywhere else. This class will take a lot of your time. Prefer taking another elective which is less heavy. Because this class requires hard work to get an A.

Marnie is such a wonderful person who is a rare breed of professor who shows a passion to find new ways for her students to learn. What a concept. Although her tests are definition heavy, she does this to prepare you for future exams (so blame the education system if you don't like her tests, not the prof for preparing you for the future).

Marnie has no soul for her students. class average fall 2017 is merely 60%. This is a first year course. Even if you study all the material you could and memorize, she will make sure you don't get the mark you deserve. oppressing as heck.

I was unfortunate to take this class in fall 2017 as Marnie had changed the usual structure of this class. First Midterm open book- encouraged us to write our own words. Second Midterm Closed Book- Got zero for writing in my own words. Final Closed Book- Gives the instruction to memorize answers. Not sure what she really wants!!

I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot. It's a good 100 level class because the concepts expand on what you may already know and give you a deeper sense of what is going on in the world. I really enjoyed the tutorials an would recommend this class for everyone!!

This lady is amazing. One of the smartest professors I've experienced at SFU - she's smart as a whip. I took this as an arts student for B-Sci. TON of content, but not too science-y - Keep up with the chapters. This class changed the way I think about the world and the environment - wish I could take another one with her.
Not an easy GPA booster and the professor will make sure you fail if you don't put in the work.
I took this course back in fall 2016 and it was super easy because she would give you a question bank before hand which contains the exam questions.

EVSC100 began for EVSC majors, but since 2015 has been available to non-science students as an elective. Keen/high performing students rate it highly and as 'easy'. It is NOT easy for those who lack science background or just want a credit. Format is 20% tutorials, 80% exams, so take good notes, study hard, and attend class to succeed.

Marnie is among the worst profs I've had in years at SFU. She goes too fast for students to catch all that she says (a fair amount of which is on exams), and only tests rote memorization and a lot more that I can't fit. Marnie managed to turn a course I was very excited about, into something I dreaded - even though I did well.

Worst instructor ever. Always rambles about irrelevant things. Tries to inspire students to pursue EVSC field but she makes a 100-level class so horrible no one would ever want to. Makes you follow her absurd rules & marks extremely hard. Instead of learning potentially interesting material, students are simply memorizing. Painful class to sit thru
She marks hard. Looks for any chance she can get to take marks away. Talks way too fast for anyone to understand her lectures and she is condescending during class.

Very defensive, seems to dislike students. While I understand her methodology of full sentences/grammar, our first opportunity to test these skills is a 40% midterm. There is very little leeway for grades if you don't write down EXACTLY what she has in her notes. An absolutely painful class. It's a pity, as the subject matter is interesting.

Not that difficult of a class. Marnie does her best to prepare you for the exams by providing question banks before both and mentioning things  that could be on exams. Exams are marked very hard for a 100 level course. They look for any opportunity to take marks off. Lastly, as others have mentioned, she talks very fast and is often late to class.

Her lectures are a pain to sit through.  She does not treat the students with respect and treats us like we are in elementary school.  In the midterm she yelled at two girls for sitting together because she thought they were friends.  I'm pretty sure everyone else sat with their friends too, and everyone got a different exam anyways.

Lecture notes are hard to read, some slides have incorrect info.  Notes have bad grammar which is ironic because she will take marks off of your answers if you don't write in full sentences or use proper grammar.  She talks too fast and rambles on , running out of time in class.  She's always late too and started the midterm 20 minutes late.

A wonderful prof who is both knowledgeable and passionate! Grading was tough, but more than fair as the question bank for tests were provided before the exams. The course was relatively easy for those willing to work hard, and I look forwards to taking more classes with Professor Branfireun in the future!

Marnie is a very caring person, however, her exams were a bit much. Exam were  marked challenging for a 100 level course. Lectures were boring-- basically sit through 100 lecture slides with no break. The only incentive for lectures is that she will answer some exam questions. Tutorials were probably the best part, as my TA was really helpful!

Marnie will often tell you specific things in lecture that will be on the exams... so go to lecture. Allot of the exam questions are straight out of the lecture notes word for word. This is more of a concept course than memorization. Not allot of homework.

Great prof really wants her students to do well. Provides question bank before both exams. Don't buy the textbook her notes have everything you need. Not a difficult class, there's no reason for anyone to do poorly in this class. Definitely recommend it!

Marnie is a great professor and her class is relatively easy. There are only 2 exams, no term papers, and she gives the exam questions before hand but you do have to work for the grade. She is a fair marker and is very knowledgeable. Her lectures are long with no breaks but she is fantastic at presenting course material and keeps you interested.

Marnie was really great about exams, she provides you with an exam bank full of all possible questions, memorize those and its a easy A. Lectures are really long and there aren't any breaks which were tough to stay in but Marnie does her best to make things interesting. Would take again, easy way to fulfill your sci credit, dont buy textbook!

Makes you follow her  absurd rules, and wastes time of students in exams dictating stupid rules in the middle of exams. Makes me kinda remember middle school. As far as the course content goes, it's kinda boring. Avoid at all cost.
She is not a teacher.  she  says that because she is  the professor she can give you what mark she feels like. Don't take her class is not worth your time.

This class was very stimulating. Marnie puts a lot of effort into making the learning environment as positive as possible. I did not, however, like the  exam questions given out before the exam. This only encourages studying the answers to the questions, leaving fragmented information, and seriously inflating grades.

Marnie makes this class as easy as possible to do well in. She gives clues throughout the term to exam questions, she gives you a question bank before the exam, and she makes the content clear and understandable. I took this class as a breadth science course and am sad that Marnie is not teaching any other lower level sciences.
Super cool prof. Lecture is 2 hours but she makes the time bearable, and the content is pretty interesting too. She always gives out exam hints in class, so make sure you attend.

Marnie is excellent. I hadn't taken science since grade11 but EVSC100 was great. How to get an A or A+: Go to tutorial (easy 20%). Midtermfinal are 40% each & you get a question bank before. Write out answers using lecture slides & your notes, remember as much as you can. Many questions will be bonus & only boost your mark too. Textbook optional.
